title: Plugz - Better Luck [1981] Punk Rock
description:
Plugz were formed in 1978 in Los Angeles and disbanded in 1984. Members were Tito Larriva (vocals, guitar), Tony Marsico (guitar), Barry McBride (bass, vocals), Charlie "Chalo" Quintana (drums), Cliff Roman (guitar, bass) 

Related Artists: The Flesh Eaters, Tito & Tarantula, Cruzados, Snake Farm, The Weirdos, Izzy Stradlin & the Ju Ju Hounds, The Havalinas, Social Distortion.

Tracks:

A1 Better Luck  
A2 Red Eye #9  
A3 Achin&#039;  
A4 American  
A5 In the Wait  
A6 El Clavo y La Cruz  
B1 Blue Sofa  
B2 Touch For Cash  
B3 Gas Line  
B4 Cesar&#039;s Song  
B5 Shifting Heart  
B6 No Love  

What did the Plugz do to get the hooks they pull off here? The selling souls was the thing of the 70s, and this was their sophomore release in the 80s, so that&#039;s out of the question. Maybe a pop-music assassination?
